explanation: The report is correct. In OS_TimeBaseGetInfo the local pointer timebase is only used for read-only accesses (nominal_interval_time, freerun_time, accuracy_usec) and is assigned from OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_timebase_table, token). Declaring it as a pointer-to-const (const OS_timebase_internal_record_t *timebase) is allowed (a pointer to const may point at a non-const object) and would satisfy MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 which recommends const-qualifying pointers when possible. There are no uses in the function that require a non-const pointer, so making this change is feasible and safe.
